briefTitle: Temporary Gastric Electrical Stimulation for Drug Refractory Gastroparesis

armGroups.label: Gastric Stimulation Days1-4/Sham5-8
interventionNames: Device: Gastric Electrical Stimulator, Enterra, Medtronics, Inc.

armGroups.label: Sham1-4/Gastric Stimulation Days5-8
interventionNames: Device: Gastric Electrical Stimulator, Enterra, Medtronics, Inc.

interventions.name: Gastric Electrical Stimulator, Enterra, Medtronics, Inc.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Sex: Male of Female
* Age Range: 18 to 70 inclusive
* Patients with GP of diabetic, surgically related or idiopathic etiology.
* Symptoms of GP for \>/= 1 year.
* Refractory or intolerant to antiemetic drug classes (antihistamines and phenothiazines, serotonin receptor antagonists, dopamine receptor antagonists)
* Chronic vomiting and/or nausea with 7 or more episodes per week for either symptom irrespective of GET values.
* The patient is willing and able to provide informed consent.
* The patient is willing and able to return for required follow-up visits.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients \< 18 or \>70 years in age.
* Patients with an active infection of any kind.
* Patients who the investigator determines are not candidates for endoscopic procedures.
* Women who are pregnant
* Inability or unwillingness to provide informed consent
* Unwilling or unable to return for required follow-up visits and examinations.
* Patients who are currently enrolled in another investigation of a medical device or drug.

outcomeMeasures.title: Symptom of Vomiting Associated With Gastroparesis
outcomeMeasures.description: Likert Scale 0-4 (low-high) using a patient reported outcomes tool

outcomeMeasures.title: Symptom of Nausea Associated With Gastroparesis
outcomeMeasures.description: Likert Scale 0-4 (low-high) using a patient reported outcomes tool

outcomeMeasures.title: Symptom of Gastric Emptying Time (GET) Associated With Gastroparesis
outcomeMeasures.description: Transit time of a radio-labeled meal through the stomach, measured by scintigraphy for %contents remaining in the stomach at 1 hour, 2 hours, and 4 hours. GET measures were obtained at baseline, during the period allowed for 'washout', and on the final study day.
